COMMITTEE ON SCIENTIFIC AIDS TO LEARNING

41 EAST 42ND STREET, NEW YORK, N.Y.
James B. Conant, Chairman Telephone: Murray Hill 2-8352
Vannevar Bush
L. D. Coffman
Ross G. Harrison
Frank B. Jewett
Bethuel M. Webster
Ben D. Wood
Irvin Stewart, Director January 28, 1939
Mr. Frank Schooley
Radio Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
Since my letter to you of October 14, 1938,
inquiring as to your report on recording equipment, this Committee
has decided to issue a report on sound recording equipment for
schools. Our interest is not in recording equipment for broadcast
stations but in equipment for use in classrooms. We expect the
report to consider the advantages and disadvantages of film, magnetic
tape and disc recording systems and, with respect to disc, to
contain definite information designed to assist schools in selecting
equipment suited to their needs.
I shall appreciate it if you will let me know to
what extent your report on sound recording equipment will cover
this field, as we have no desire to duplicate anything you are doing.
I should also like to get your suggestions as
to individuals whom you consider as competent to prepare such a
report. Obviously, the reporter must not only be technically comÂ¬
petent, but he must have no connection or bias which would tend
to invalidate his conclusions.
Perhaps I should add that this Committee is
entirely supported by Carnegie Corporation of New York.
Sincerely yours,
Irvin Stewart,
is/gq Director
